entry.title: COMPASS: Immunotherapy Outcome Prediction
entry.content: New preprint introducting COMPASS: A generalizable AI that predicts immunotherapy outcomes across cancers and treatments. [Project website] [Code]
entry.summary: New preprint introducting COMPASS: A generalizable AI that predicts immunotherapy outcomes across cancers and treatments. [Project website] [Code]

entry.title: ATOMICA - A Universal Model of Molecular Interactions

link.title: ATOMICA - A Universal Model of Molecular Interactions

entry.content: New preprint introducing ATOMICA, a universal model of intermolecular interactions across proteins, small molecules, ions, peptides, RNA, and DNA. [Kempner Institute]
entry.summary: New preprint introducing ATOMICA, a universal model of intermolecular interactions across proteins, small molecules, ions, peptides, RNA, and DNA. [Kempner Institute]

link.title: On Biomedical AI in Harvard Gazette

entry.title: TxAgent: AI Agent for Therapeutic Reasoning

link.title: TxAgent: AI Agent for Therapeutic Reasoning

entry.content: TxAgent is an AI agent for therapeutic reasoning that consolidates 211 tools from trusted sources, including all US FDA-approved drugs since 1939 and validated clinical insights. [Project website] [TxAgent] [ToolUniverse]
entry.summary: TxAgent is an AI agent for therapeutic reasoning that consolidates 211 tools from trusted sources, including all US FDA-approved drugs since 1939 and validated clinical insights. [Project website] [TxAgent] [ToolUniverse]

entry.title: Multimodal AI predicts clinical outcomes of drug combinations from preclinical data

link.title: Multimodal AI predicts clinical outcomes of drug combinations from preclinical data

entry.content: New paper: Multimodal AI approach for designing combination therapies with improved predictive accuracy and clinical relevance. [Project website]
entry.summary: New paper: Multimodal AI approach for designing combination therapies with improved predictive accuracy and clinical relevance. [Project website]

entry.title: KGARevion: AI Agent for Knowledge-Intensive Biomedical QA

link.title: KGARevion: AI Agent for Knowledge-Intensive Biomedical QA

entry.content: KGARevion is an AI agent designed for complex biomedical QA that integrates the non-codified knowledge of LLMs with the structured, codified knowledge found in knowledge graphs. [ICLR 2025 publication]
entry.summary: KGARevion is an AI agent designed for complex biomedical QA that integrates the non-codified knowledge of LLMs with the structured, codified knowledge found in knowledge graphs. [ICLR 2025 publication]

entry.title: MedTok: Unlocking Medical Codes for GenAI

link.title: MedTok: Unlocking Medical Codes for GenAI

entry.content: Meet MedTok, a multimodal medical code tokenizer that transforms how AI understands structured medical data. By integrating textual descriptions and relational contexts, MedTok enhances tokenization for transformer-based models—powering everything from EHR foundation models to medical QA. [Project website]
entry.summary: Meet MedTok, a multimodal medical code tokenizer that transforms how AI understands structured medical data. By integrating textual descriptions and relational contexts, MedTok enhances tokenization for transformer-based models—powering everything from EHR foundation models to medical QA. [Project website]

entry.title: What If You Could Rewrite Biology? Meet CLEF

link.title: What If You Could Rewrite Biology? Meet CLEF

entry.content: What if we could anticipate molecular and medical changes before they happen? Introducing CLEF, an approach for counterfactual generation in biological and medical sequence models. [Project website]
entry.summary: What if we could anticipate molecular and medical changes before they happen? Introducing CLEF, an approach for counterfactual generation in biological and medical sequence models. [Project website]

entry.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models

link.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models

entry.content: New paper on the role of digital twins as global health and disease learning models for preventive and personalized medicine.
entry.summary: New paper on the role of digital twins as global health and disease learning models for preventive and personalized medicine.
